summary: vim script for color palette etc.
name: colorpalette.vim
description:
A very simple range of colors to color words or line temporarily... 

http://www.intratel.es/cubica/dominios/joyasur/gtemp/cp.jpg

"USAGE:

"To see the Palette of colors:
        "normal mode: ;p
        "command: Palette
"To select a color:
        "normal mode: <RightMouse> or <Up> <Down> arrows 
"To color a word or a line:
        "normal mode for background: <Space>
        "normal mode for foreground: <M-Space>
        "visual mode for background: <RightMouse>
        "visual mode for foreground: <M-RightMouse>
"Color HEX and RGB information:
        "normal mode: i
        "popup menu: info color

"Note: To see in Status-Line the color that has been selected --donÂ´t forget to change the default number of "User".

versions.release_notes: Added:  more colors, HEX and RGB color information, easy selection with Up and Down arrows; LeftMouse single click for selecting a color ---
